javadoc:
Service to manage navigation markers displayed around a scrollable window like the codebrowser. The navigation bar displays the general location of markers for the entire view. The marker bar displays a marker at each marked address visible within the view.

The interface defines priorities for display of markers in Marker Margin and colored bars in Navigation Margin. The higher the priority, the more likely the marker/bar will be displayed on the top. Areas will always be lower than marker priorities.

Recommended Usage
The service used to work independent of {@link Program}s. In order to work effectively this service has been changed to associate created markers with individual programs. Thus, it is up to the clients of this class perform lifecycle management of markers created by this service. For example, a client that creates a marker from {@link #createAreaMarker(String, String, Program, int, boolean, boolean, boolean, Color)} should call {@link #removeMarker(MarkerSet, Program)} when the markers are no longer used, such as when a program has become deactivated. In this example usage markers are added and removed as the user tabs through open programs.

methods.name: createAreaMarker
methods.comment: Create a Marker display which shows area type markers.

params.name: name
params.comment: name of the navigation markers

params.name: markerDescription
params.comment: description of the navigation markers

params.name: program
params.comment: The program with which the created markers will be associated.

params.name: priority
params.comment: to sort out what displays on top, higher is more likely to be on top

params.name: showMarkers
params.comment: true indicates to show area markers (on the left side of the browser.)

params.name: showNavigation
params.comment: true indicates to show area navigation markers (on the right side of the browser.)

params.name: colorBackground
params.comment: if true, then the browser's background color will reflect the marker.

params.name: color
params.comment: the color of marked areas.

methods.comment:
This version of createAreaMarker() does not take a program and has thus been
 deprecated.  See the recommended usage for more information.

params.name: markerManager
params.comment: marker manager to be removed from navigation bars.

params.name: program
params.comment: The program with which the markers are associated.

methods.name: removeMarker
methods.comment:
Remove the marker manager.  This method is deprecated,
 see the recommended usage for more information.

params.name: markerManager
params.comment: marker manager to be removed from navigation bars.

methods.name: getMarkerSet
methods.comment: Return the markerset with the given name;

params.name: program
params.comment: The program with which the created markers will be associated.

return.comment: the markerset with the given name;

methods.name: getMarkerSet
methods.comment:
Return the markerset with the given name.  This method is deprecated,
 see the recommended usage for more information.

return.comment: the markerset with the given name;

methods.name: setMarkerForGroup
methods.comment:
Sets a marker set for a given group name.  Any previous marker set associated with the
 given group name will be removed from this marker service.  This method is used to ensure
 that only one marker set is used at any time for a give group.

params.name: groupName
params.comment: The name to associate the marker set with.

params.name: markerSet
params.comment: The marker set to add to this service

params.name: program
params.comment: The program with which the markers are associated.

methods.name: removeMarkerForGroup
methods.comment:
Removes a marker set for a given group name.  If the given marker set is not the marker
 set associated with the given group name, then no action will be taken.

params.name: groupName
params.comment: The name associated the marker set with.

params.name: markerSet
params.comment: The marker set to add to this service

params.name: program
params.comment:
The program with which the markers are associated.  May be null if the
        marker is

methods.name: getBackgroundColor
methods.comment:
Returns the background color associated with the given address.  Each markerSet that supports
 background coloring is checked in priority order to see if it wants to specify a background
 color for the given address.

params.name: address
params.comment: the address to check for a background color.

return.comment: the background color to use for that address or null if no markers contain that address.

methods.name: addChangeListener
methods.comment:
Adds a change listener to be notified when markers are added/removed or the addresses in
 any current markerSets are changed.

params.name: listener
params.comment: the listener to be notified.

methods.javadoc:
Removes the given change listener from the list of listeners to be notified of changes.
@param listener
methods.name: removeChangeListener
methods.comment: Removes the given change listener from the list of listeners to be notified of changes.

name: MarkerService
comment:
Service to manage navigation markers displayed around a scrollable window
 like the codebrowser.  The navigation bar displays the general location of
 markers for the entire view.  The marker bar displays a marker at each marked
 address visible within the view. 
 
 The interface defines priorities for display of markers in Marker Margin and
 colored bars in Navigation Margin. The higher the priority, the more likely
 the marker/bar will be displayed on the top. Areas will always be lower than
 marker priorities.
 
 
 Recommended Usage
 The service used to work independent of Programs.  In order to work effectively this
 service has been changed to associate created markers with individual programs.  Thus, it is
 up to the clients of this class perform lifecycle management of markers created by this
 service.  For example, a client that creates a marker from
 #createAreaMarker(String, String, Program, int, boolean, boolean, boolean, Color) should call
 #removeMarker(MarkerSet, Program) when the markers are no longer used, such as when
 a program has become deactivated.  In this example usage markers are added and removed as the
 user tabs through open programs.

A group name for highlights.  This is intended to be used with
